{{also|baby}} ==Cebuano== ===Etymology=== From {{m|en|baby}}. Also from an error in birth registration. When the parent has not decided on a name of the child, the child is often listed as ''baby'' + ''surname''. ====Proper noun==== {{head|ceb|proper noun}} # {{given name|ceb|female|A=a}} # {{lb|ceb|rare}} {{given name|ceb|male|A=a}} ---- ==German== ===Etymology=== Borrowed from {{bor|de|en|baby}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|[ˈbeːbi]}} * {{audio|de|De-Baby.ogg|Audio}} ===Noun=== {{de-noun|n|Babys|Babys|pl2=Babies}} # [[baby]] {{qualifier|infant}} ====Usage notes==== * The plural ''{{l|de|Babies}}'' is now proscribed, but still in use. ====Declension==== {{de-decl-noun-n|s|s}} ====Synonyms==== * {{l|de|Säugling}} ====Derived terms==== * {{l|de|Babybauch}} * {{l|de|babyleicht}} * {{l|de|babyeinfach}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}} [[Category:de:People]]
